website_summaries.verdict: Suitable for all ages and activity levels, this simple toy has a captivating appeal that keeps felines coming back for more. Fun, functional, and affordable.
pros: Circular track and ball offer entertainment that never ends
Suitable for group or solitary play
One of the few toys that blind cats can enjoy, too
Replaceable scratch pad gives cats something to sink their claws into
Comes with catnip to entice felines
cons: Random color delivered – cannot order a specific one

customer_reviews.title: I like it and my cat
customer_reviews.text: I like it and my cat, who is very old and not very enthusiastic about toys in general, plays with it sometimes. For seconds. Knowing him as I know, I would say it is quite impressive hehe After a few seconds, he just ends up cutely sitting in the middle of the toy or lying down on the ball to make it stop moving. This is my toothless lazy guy. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Mônica Klein

customer_reviews.title: Even tiny kittens love it.
customer_reviews.text: I foster cats and litters, so I can say from experience that very few cats can resist this toy, especially if you sprinkle the catnip on it. Even tiny kittens love it.
customer_reviews.author: Marauge

customer_reviews.title: Good toy. Shipping box was better received.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Sturdy. Came with catnip. The ball captivated their attention and they used the cardboard ring to scratch on. The cats loved this toy for all but two days. The box how ever has been a big part of their lives. They play in it. They chill in it. They scratch on it. They even have cuddle sessions in there when they can't cuddle with me. I don't know why I bother buying special toys for them when I should just be buying boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Windir19

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy about this...
customer_reviews.text: Mine came without the ball! There seems no way to contact the company, so I hope they will see this. Although they sell the replacement balls, those cost more than the scratcher, and I am not happy about this. The kitties immediately began using the scratcher, and tearing at the catnip bag, so I don't feel I can return it. Nowhere to contact the company, as far as I can tell. :(
customer_reviews.author: aine faireheart

customer_reviews.title: No ball!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy, in theory, for a great price. However, it's missing one key component: the ball. I assumed it was maybe just a fluke and went to find a ping pong ball or something else. But then I came back to see if I just misread the description, I saw that not only is it clearly stated in the product description that this comes with a ball, but my deliver wasn't a fluke and several others have complained about receiving their toy without a ball, too. It's kinda the whole point of the toy. Very annoying/disappointing that there has been such a significant oversight in quality control, or a blatant misrepresentation of the product by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T Lanzone

customer_reviews.title: No ball included, no way to contact anyone for a missing item
customer_reviews.text: I have rarely written a bad review, but when I received the Turbo scratcher it was shrinkwrapped and had not been damaged. But the ball was not included, and it states the ball is included. I came online to request a ball, but there were no options to contact anyone. All I could do was replace it. So I ordered a ball, which of course was an additional charge. I also ran searches for the word 'ball' in the reviews and questions. I'm not the only one who has did not receive a ball so I suspect this isn't a quality control issue. Useless without one, unless you want to pay too much for a cardboard cat scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: Charlee L.

customer_reviews.title: 2 BLIND RESCUE CATS LOVE THIS TOY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My two 100% BLIND rescue cats absolutely LOVE this toy!!! Having no eyeballs and extensive surgeries (due to inherited feline herpes from their two different mothers), these girls were going to be put down because they were not "Adoptable". But they are incredibly loving, kind, caring, FULL OF LIFE, and VERY NORMAL feline ladies! Their sense of hearing is phenomenal, and I hoped this toy would be enjoyable for them. IT. IS. PERFECT. 👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: MimiX4boys

customer_reviews.title: Yes...wait.....nope.
customer_reviews.text: One cat played with it for 5 minutes, the other isn’t interested and the baby one comes and plays for a minute than leaves and comes back. I’m hoping they find more interest in it as time goes on. Might need to put it on carpet so that it doesn’t just slide around everywhere. 4 stars for now because there was an initial interest. Will update. Update: played with it for two hours the first day. Never been touched since. Going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyMiche

customer_reviews.title: The cat loves it, 'nough said.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves it, what else is there to say. The cardboard circles last a decent amount of time and can be flipped over for round 2. And the replacements are inexpensive. We replaced the white ball with one that lights up (Bergan Twinkle Replacement Ball) - probably more for our amusement than the cat's. I would put this activity in an area of the house away from bedrooms if, like us, you have a cat who likes to get up at 3AM and party. I've put some catnip and catnip spray on the pad a few times but it's really not necessary and doesn't encourage more play. He plays with it enough without the additional encouragement.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't entertain my cat at all
customer_reviews.text: This was my experience too. My cat, who is very playful, got into it for about five minutes. But if the ball came to rest on the other side of the toy, he couldn't be bothered to walk over and bat it, and who could blame him? Frankly, I think the whole category of cat toys is a fraud. I've never had a toy that interested a cat after the first few minutes. Even the best toy of all -- the laser pointer -- loses interest very quickly. Cats are happy to watch you act like a fool trying to get them interested. They find that entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the base would be a little sturdier but it's pretty flimsy plastic, my kitty likes to pounce on the ball when it's spinning but it'll move the whole thing which scares him lol. there's a little hole that presumably you can use to nail down, but as an apartment renter there's no way I could nail something to the ground. The ball stays in very well which is nice, and my cat likes it enough. he doesn't like the cat nip scratching cardboard part, but i think that's just because he's a weirdo and nothing to do with the design.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous218

customer_reviews.title: Love this scratcher/toy combo
customer_reviews.text: My Sir Thor loves cardboard scratcher, I hate the mess of cardboard bits all over the place. With the design of this scratcher he gets what he wants and the well that the ball is in catches all the mess. We are both very very happy with this and will be buying refills! Because I'm in an apartment I can't secure it to the floor but I don't want to because then I can't empty the cardboard bits as easily. Besides, Sir Thor seems to like putting his front paws on it and scootching it around like a toddler with a learn to walk toy.
customer_reviews.author: Granhedda

customer_reviews.title: Smell of plastic is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on good reviews. When we got it our cat hit the ball a few time and never touched it again. What I noticed was him sniffing the plastic a few times and shaking his head. The smell of the plastic is terrible! I put it on our patio for a couple of days just to see if it will get better. I may have to return it if it doesn't. I am very surprised nobody mentions this smell...
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Do not throw the included black non-skid feet and catnip bags by mistake
customer_reviews.text: The cats love this. They love to sit on top of it too. The ball is a little bit weighted which makes it more fun for the ball to spin around. Make sure you do not throw the two very small zipper bags away by accident with the packaging. I accidentally threw them both away and had to dig through the garbage. It is a tiny Ziploc bag of catnip and a tiny Ziploc bag that has little black non-skid feet that need to be stuck on the bottom of this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT toy ....
customer_reviews.text: Really bought this for the scratcher center but my BIG Maine Coon has no interest in that attribute. He does, however, absolutely love the track and ball. He will be in the back room and suddenly run down the hall and attack the track and ball with great vigor. Or he lays on the center of it and shoves the ball around. Or he stands in the middle of the scratcher section and flips the ball while jumping in circles. I really needed the scratcher tool because he destroys them with great regularity but his pleasure in the toy part of this gadget makes it a really valuable purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Von Struble

customer_reviews.title: No Ball - Geez
customer_reviews.text: Product description says, "ball included". Every picture shows ball. NO BALL. I put a spare ping pong ball in it. Looks like it is too small, but how would I know? Cat totally IGNORES the ball. Absolutely no interest. This cat plays with empty boxes, with hair ties, with "fish", with damn near everything. Loves the scratching pad when covered with catnip. But, the ball - NOTHING. I can't take points off because of the cat. Maybe other cats love this. But... certainly take points off for NO BALL. Packaging was fabulous. Love that it's a "Product of the USA". Meanwhile, the cat is playing with the Amazon box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Dick B.

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Comes with powdered catnip to sprinkle on the cardboard scratcher, my 4 cats love it and they have STOPPED scratching at my furniture! They love the ball, it fun to watch the "matches" the cats set up. 2 or 3 at a time bat the ball to another cat and back and forth. They will play for an hour or more at a time. Non slip rubber feet keep it from sliding around the floors. They are happy and so am I. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Moonminx

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Approved
customer_reviews.text: Our new, 8mo old cat seems mostly disinterested in toys so we weren't sure if she would enjoy this. Put it down and she was hooked instantly--it's the only toy she has deigned to play with for more than a few seconds. It's been great for keeping her entertained and getting out all her kitten energy. She also seems pretty interested in the catnip but we'll have to see if this turns out to be a fave scratching spot. My only complaint is that the slick plastic slides when its on hardwood floor or tile. She plays very energetically so we have to keep it on carpeted areas or she gets frustrated and leaves.
customer_reviews.author: M Kim

customer_reviews.title: they both love chasing that strange mindnumbing thing....
customer_reviews.text: Both cats love to play with this. The male sits in the middle and thumbs it around again and again. Mostly when i get on the phone .... The female lays across it, to the side of it, anything that amuses her. they often claw the ball out to fly across the room then chase it again. You will get some laughs from their obsession. I would show them if this is new to them... just in case. Once they see it rolling around, an obsession is born
customer_reviews.author: Gina C.

customer_reviews.title: Love these, have had them for years, will never be without them!
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for years! Have trained all my kitties to scratch on them, and they have never once touched the furniture. They love these. Just keep rubbing a little catnip into the cardboard and you’ll never have a problem with them going near your furniture. They also love to roll the ball around the track. If the ball gets stuck sometimes, get out an emery board and just file down the seams of the ball. Sometimes they are just a little too thick and they interfere with the ball spinning around the track. Also, keep the track clean of dust and little catnip leaves. It keeps the ball spinning at TopSpeed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: I need a cat with a higher IQ!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 year old cat we got from the Humane Society six weeks ago. I bought this toy for her about the same time. I'm thinking if I were a cat this would be fun stuff! I mean, the ball rolls at the slightest touch, and it has a scratch pad! But alas, she prefers to scratch on a wood post, and the ball is of no interest. To be fair she'd rather play with a piece of string than swat at the feather cat toy I also bought her. Next time it will be a kitten I get. I mean, I already have all the toys...
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Listening

customer_reviews.title: As simple as it gets—yet our very best cat toy EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Like the old style card board box with corrugated scratching filler, this incredibly simple product is an everyday favorite. The corrugated scratching piece is the most durable my kitties have ever seen. The heavy duty plastic that holds the pad keeps it all in place.And yes, they really did secure the cardboard pad so my 22lb BIG BOY doesn’t do a bit of damage no matter how hard he tries. Finally tap a little catnip over it Is like seasoning a pizza and give the ping pong ball a quick spin around the gutter and your kitty will join “the best toy ever” club.... and it’s even interactive which is so kool!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats Got Bored In 2 Days
customer_reviews.text: All three of my cats got bored within two days or weren't interested in the first place -- not only with the toy ball but with the cat scratch cardboard component as well. The catnip included didn't entice them any further. For seven months now the item has been on the floor of a spare room collecting dust. It's now time to conclude the item was a waste of money, recycle the cardboard, and throw away the remaining plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Mi-Fi

customer_reviews.title: Stationary
customer_reviews.text: Stays together because the cats don't play with it much. I got it for my kitten a year ago because she enjoys chasing things and I thought she'd enjoy this. She did play with it at the start (at night to annoy me while I slept), but once she was allowed into the rest of the house, she ignored it. She actually enjoys a chase and not being stationary to bat around a toy. The cats will sometimes play with it, but usually don't.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lightberry

customer_reviews.title: My new kitten loves it
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these years ago for former cats, but they mostly ignored it. We got a 12 week old kitten a few days ago and decided to try this since it is a toy but also has material in the center for scratching claws. She loves it! She pounces on it and thinks the ball is chasing her when she swats it around the circle. I like it because she not only can entertain herself with it, but the ball can't get out of the track and get lost under furniture. The only negative is that she doesn't use the cardboard scratching area, even after we sprayed it with catnip. Oh well, it's great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: ccsteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: An excellent scratching "post" option
customer_reviews.text: This is a big hit with our 5 cats. They have an indifferent view of the ball, but they all really love the scratching part of it. When they occasionally spin the ball, usually by accident, reactions range from watching it curiously to racing away possibly in terror. (Though that cat tends to race away from just about everything.) This little spinner is a bargain because you can turn the scratch pad to use it twice, and buy replacement pads for a reasonable price. I can already tell this item will be enjoyed for a very long time, at a much more affordable price than many similar items.
customer_reviews.author: MommySan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy. The cat loves it. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a winner. My cat has never actively played with a toy until this. This is also the first scratcher she’s actually used. This is a good buy. It also comes with a packet of catnip, which was ALSO the first catnip my cat enjoyed. Haha. The cardboard is replaceable. You could even cut your own strip and coil it in there to save money. There are little rubber feet to help it stay in place, but it will still scoot around a bit on hardwood. The ball seems solid, not like a ping pong ball. So that adds to its longevity, I think.
customer_reviews.author: DJ E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Weight of Ball and Track: Cats VERY Pleased
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased MANY versions of this type of circle-ball-in-track thingies, but none of them had the critical mass/heft to keep the ball in near “Eternal Free Spin” long enough for the cats to maintain interest longer than 15 seconds. This one is near perfect, like one of those digit spinners. The cats find this one deeply gratifying. Unfortunately, they especially like using it in the middle of the night for 30 min sessions. We turn it over when heading to bed. The quality of this one is not quite as nice as our original one from ten years ago, but far higher quality than the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Definite must have!
customer_reviews.text: This cat toy is fun for our kittens and also for us to watch. Both kittens in our house love it and have played with it lots since I took it out of the box. I am thankful because they have been getting more curious, jumping on counters and knocking things over. This holds their attention and keeps them from doing more destructive things. Hoping it lasts quite some time but I would also buy it again if this one gets worn out. It is worth it! I have bought them other toys that they have not played with nearly as much. You should buy this toy!
customer_reviews.author: lovemykids05Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it, and the plastic part lasts a long time together, after months of constant use, they managed to get the ball out. But no biggie, it could be put right in. Why I deduct a star is because of the replacement cardboards are pretty expensive. They don't last that long and I just bought some more, 2 of them for $8, about the price of the toy itself. Great toy, just be prepared to get the cardboard refills to make cats happy. If prices went down on the refills online and in pet stores, it would be one of the best toys I would have gotten my cats. Especially recommended for those kitties that love balls in particular.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply, flimsy made.  Ball comes right out. Not made like they used to.
customer_reviews.text: These are not made like they used to be. Previous were thick, sturdy plastic - strong enough that the ball could not be removed. This one is cheap, flimsy and the ball comes right out. I can’t use it until I get a different ball because my dogs will end up getting a hold of it and choking on it. If you only have a cat in the home and not other animals, you should be okay when the ball inevitably comes flying out. Not pleased with my purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: EVERY cat owner should have one or several
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these things now. When I bought the first one they were about $24 but quickly found out they are 100% worth the money. I have changed the scratching part of this thing countless times. When I saw these things were sooo cheap I bought 2 more, one for my bedroom and one to take with me on an extended trip overseas for the kittens I will be receiving there. This is the only cat toy I taking with me because I think it is absolutely the best toy on the market and I'd hate to not be able to find it abroad. Easily worth 2 to 3 times the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: SBD

customer_reviews.title: Ball gone within days doesn’t seem normal, right?
customer_reviews.text: Our cats didn’t immediately like it, but the catnip did the job! when they did started to like it, the ball cake out wat to easy and ine day i came home( I only take it out when we are not home, so as a being alone -toy)and the ball was gone, and I mean GONE, can’t find it anywhere. The answers and question section recommends buying an other ball, so it must be common thing, which lets me down even more..with this happening within days; a new ball send would be appreciated...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kitten is obsessed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest: I’m kind of judging my kitten here. What does she find so amusing about this toy? It’s just a ball on a track. Where is the thrill, the novelty? How can she bat this ball around with ferocious intensity for hours on end? No clue. But she does! This is hands down her favorite toy. It’s sturdy, nice looking (I mean, for a cat toy?) and has a bunch of cool (for a cat toy) attachments you can add, like grooming arches. We rotate our kittens’ toys frequently, but she demands we always leave this one out.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Fun and exercise for 3 generations of cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely LOVE this as a toy and a good scratch area that can hold a bit of catnip. It is the 2nd one we have bought. It lasted for the lives of 2 cats and we only need this one as we had given away our old one to a friend because it still worked like new, and then we got another cat. We tried a couple of other toys but she had started clawing furniture so we knew this would work!! This cat even likes to sit or curl up over the middle of it when she isn’t playing or scratching! She’s a big kitty but it still makes a firm bed!
customer_reviews.author: SkyeByrd

customer_reviews.title: Mesmerizing toy
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how much the kitten loves this toy. She is playing with it as I write this review. The toy does make noise as the ball spins and the toy has a tendency to scoot across the floor as she attacks it. The noise is minimal and not bothersome to me.However, you might want to put it away at night if you are a light sleeper. She doesn't really play with the cardboard scratch board in the center, but does spin the ball around and around. This toy is so simple, but the kitten is mesmerized.
customer_reviews.author: Review-O-Matic

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Entertainment!
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I had several cats and the old heavy duty version of this cat toy. It was always a hit and sometimes a battleground. I sent this one as a gift to my older brother for his two cats, one ancient cat and a new kitten. It has provided fun and entertainment not just for the kitten, but for my brother and the old cat who watches on as well. I can't speak to the quality (I didn't ask) but they are happy and that makes me happy, especially at a time where we are rather stuck at home...
customer_reviews.author: Bakersfield Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy for cats
customer_reviews.text: Our office cat LOVES this toy, so I bought it for my nieces' cats for Christmas. The little one took to it immediately. What's nice about it is that cats can entertain themselves with it, but you can also use it interactively - kind of a ping-pong match between you and your cat. The scratching pad in the middle lasts pretty well (I always turn it over to get more life out of it) and replacements are inexpensive and easy to find, but not really necessary as the main attraction is the ball. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: L. Horn

customer_reviews.title: My cat on this toy: "meh" - new cat gives it an extra star and new idea!
customer_reviews.text: Every once and a while my cat will sit on this thing a little. If I put cat nip on it - he's a bit more interested for a brief time. Overall my cat gives it a "meh". Edit: Had to upgrade the rating - new cat loves it. ***I ordered some beer pong balls 'cause the new cat likes chasing them and stuff - they fit but are small enough to actually remove - it's a game changer being able to remove the ball. Cats figure out they can't remove the standard ball over time and get bored. As always - cats are finicky - worked for one of my cats - the other still meh.
customer_reviews.author: S King

customer_reviews.title: Cats Go Balistic Over It But the Ball Pops Out
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my two 6 month old kittens and my 14 year old girl. The 'kids' went balistic over it! My 14 year old loves watching them and that encourages her to participate a little. But I think most of her amusement comes from watching the kids. Nix 1 star because the ball keeps popping out and now I can't find it. I wish the ball didn't pop out, but they really like it so I'm going to try getting another one. If that ball pops out, hopefully I'll be able to find 1 of the 2 balls and keep 1 at least in the game... It's worth buying a second. :)
customer_reviews.author: The Glass Box

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this.
customer_reviews.text: My cat really likes the three tower ball track toy and I figured he would like this as well. Cats get bored of the same toys so I figured rotating this and the ball tower would be keep him busy. He loves it and runs around like crazy to catch the ball. I’m happy with this purchase and would recommend it to my fellow cat parents :)
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: A Kitty Possessed
customer_reviews.text: My regular cats only gave this a passing nod. They are severely spoiled. My FOSTER kitty thinks it's the best toy they've ever invented. At 2am this morning I finally had to get up and take it away from him. He'd been playing non-stop since midnight and keeping all of us old-timers awake. He is possessed with this thing. He is the best example of a review I can give. When I finally find him a forever home, this will go with him!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and kitten LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: of all toys that I've gotten for my cat this is the one that retains his attention the most so far. He absolutely loves it. When I opened the package I had no idea how sturdy and quality of material were going to be. I was genuinely happy.l with this purchase. The center scratch post isn't really ever used by the kitty but he loves the crap out of the ball. The best part is I've gotten so many little toy balls with bells and ive lost them all. This toy is stationary and can entertain the kitty until he's tired. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Janoe

customer_reviews.title: Great Design. Sturdy. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great design. Sturdy. Good price. Paid $8.50. 1. Great design. Weight of ball allows it to roll smoothly on track, like rolling a golf ball. Weight of entire toy allows it to stay in place. 2. Perfect for small space. Cat can sit in center on top of scratcher and still play with ball. 3. Cat loves scratcher. Saw another review where customer replaced cardboard scratcher boy coiling sisal rope inside. Great idea for scratcher replacement. Note: Weight of ball makes a rolling noise maybe sounds like a smaller bowling ball rolling down a lane. But noise should be expected if you have cats!
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: 2 cons..
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with scratches front and back, looks like used but it’s wrapped with sealed plastic so I’d say it’s its own product quality problem that it’s made with scratches on it?... Another thing I don’t like about this is that you can’t pick the color. Why??? Why can’t you let customs pick the color they prefer? They are paying for the price for it they should be able to choose what they like more. I really wanted a blue one, but they sent me a purple one. Anyways overall the design and functions of this toy is good. Just these 2 cons I have problem with. Our kitty ragdoll plays with it when in the mood here there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian💕Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 10 month old kittens but even my 17yo cat sometimes boos the ball around when she thinks I’m not looking. Unfortunately, the kittens found the included bag of catnip and ate the entire bag in one night. LOL As you can see in the photo, my fat boy has found a way to remain lazy but still play with it. His brother even sometimes sleeps on the center of it. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tilga

customer_reviews.title: pay attention
customer_reviews.text: Our cats played with this off and on for two years [Even without the catnip] I had noticed that they were really starting to shred the center, but didn't think too much about it. This is where the "pay attention" part comes in. There was obviously still some catnip on it. and one of our kitties ate the cardboard...a lot of the cardboard, and ended up at the emergency Vet on a Sunday. She had a blocked bowel and a temp of 105. Its a fun toy, just keep checking it. We feel like baaad kittie parents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it but some parts are flimsy...
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this toy! My kids do too, lol. The only problem is that the center/scratcher part arrived all seperated so it fell apart in a day and wouldn't stay in the plastic part. Also, I'll make a seperate review for this but I bought the feather wand toy accessory that was $6 more! (Pretty pricey for a cheap wand with a stand) and the cat had that shredded in 2 days and since the center part is messed up I can't even use the wand with it now anyways. If my cat didn't adore the main toy with the ball this would be getting 1 star review.
customer_reviews.author: MooseJaw

customer_reviews.title: Great new toy for senior kitty
customer_reviews.text: My cat has always loved scratch pads, but I didn't think she's actually enjoy the toy aspect. However, she loves it. She will hide behind something then jump out and bat at the ball like crazy, then run and hide again. It's brought out some energy we didn't know she still had. She liked it so much I bought a second one. I also bought a few replacement circular cardboard scratchers since she's already done a lot of damage to the cardboard after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Results may vary by cat
customer_reviews.text: We have one cat that likes to hunker down and tear at the rugs. The cardboard scratcher is a huge hit with her and she's pretty much totally left her claws off other things since we got it - yay! Unfortunately, it didn't really work on the other cat who prefers to scratch vertical surfaces. I'll have to try an upright scratch board there. The ball might hold attention longer for an only or less active cat. Ours played with it a lot for a few days, but then went back to chasing each other for amusement. The noise is about the same since that rolling track is LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Kamerad

customer_reviews.title: Best money I’ve spent on a cat toy
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten this on sale but this is the best $9 I’ve ever spent on a cat. He plays with it constantly. The ball doesn’t pop out when he plays and so he’s self entertained by chasing, rolling on it, pouncing on it etc. Is it super sturdy? Probably not but certainly larger and more sturdy than I expected for the price. It does slide across the floor some but mainly that’s from our cat body slamming it. Getting another one for a different ro so he can play with it in two places.
customer_reviews.author: J. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Both cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Both cats love this! We have one cat that loves toys and plays with the ball. (The main reason I bought this was to keep her occupied while I'm trying to work.) The other cat isn't big on toys but loves nip, so we sprinkle some cat nip on the scratcher pad and she loves to roll all over it. As of yet, neither cat really uses the scratcher pad for their claws, but that's okay. The toy is bigger than I was expecting, about 16" in diameter, with the ball about 2" diameter. Mine came in purple.
customer_reviews.author: katiej

customer_reviews.title: Cats can definitely get the ball out of the track
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I saw multiple reviewers say their cats had never gotten the ball out of the track, and that even a person couldn't do it. THIS IS FALSE. It took 3 minutes for my cat to get the ball out. After many cycles of him getting it out and me popping it back it, he finally decided that he likes the toy better with the ball in the track, so he doesn't pull it out all the time any more. He enjoys it well enough, but if you're looking for a ball in track cat toy, don't buy this one, there have got to be better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and seeing "Amazon Choice" and the company's claim of "Cat scratch toy offers hours of fun and exercise for your cat" I thought this would be fun for my sibling 2 year old cats. It lasted maybe a total of 30 minutes and is now collecting fur balls in the corner of our floor. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CRL

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this! She plays with it almost every day! Running around and knocking the ball around. We did have a a few problems with stability, the rubber feet wouldn't stay on and we eventually had to move it to carpet. Not a problem now but without carpet it scrapes all over the floor as she swats the ball. You could probably find some stickier, more stable feet to use on it though! Would definitely recommend for any cat owner, especially one with an active kitty!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I was excited but my cat, Penelope, was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited but my cat, Penelope, was curious at first then skittish, now totally indifferent. She smells the extra catnip I put on it & watched as I played with the ball. She just ignores it. My friend bought one for Fluffy who had same experience. Gave hers away. I’m going to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Perfect If You Have Carpet
customer_reviews.text: My son's kitten absolutely loves the ball, although she is (for now) completely uninterested in the scratching board. My sister's adult cat, on the other hand hates the ball but will roll around on the board once fresh catnip has been added before flopping off of it and going to sleep. I only gave it 4 starts because it slides around and scratches wood floors (but has some weird screw port as if someone's actually going to attach this to the floor). It would be nicer if the bottom was solid and had rubber pegs to keep it in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I hadn’t even finished sprinkling the catnip on it before one of my cats hopped on to scratch it. The other cat went after the ball shortly after that. It’s gotten a lot of use already so I’ll be flipping the cardboard until I order a refill. Good price and well-loved. The cardboard pops out every now and then but it’s not a big deal. Make sure you add the little rubber grips that are provided so it doesn’t slide all over the place. This is my 2nd one (and many refills in between) and I will continue to buy and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Williams

customer_reviews.title: The only toy my cat likes
customer_reviews.text: My cat was born in the outdoors thus his only source of amusement was the murder of small animals. It's always been really hard to get him to play. Recently, he has been gaining weight and I worried about the quality of his boring indoor life. Although Mr. Kitters refuses every other toy, he enjoys this one and sit next to it, occasionally swatting the ball, late at night when no one is around to watch him being cute. But I can hear the ball going round and round. Either my house is haunted or my cat has finally found a toy to keep him amused! Thank you, Bergan!
customer_reviews.author: Abby Kadabi

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY a cat toy my spoiled little Princess will play with!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a huge purebred Bengal. She has ZERO interest in cat toys. Even the little red laser dot doesn't hold her interest-she follows it's path back to me=end of 1 min of fun With this toy, she loves to scratch at the middle corrugated cardboard for scratching satisfaction. I sprinkle catnip in there to make it more interesting, and I love to watch her trying to get the little ball out! It zips around the inside track-keeping her occupied and happy! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Marie M

customer_reviews.title: So good, bought 2
customer_reviews.text: This toy REALLY brought out the playfulness in our very shy Russian Blue. He loves watching the ball go around, and he uses the scratch pad almost exclusively (even though we have multiple scratchers throughout the house). Our other cat doesn't play with it, she prefers the light up peek-a-boo feather toy. We had to buy a second one after about a year because of the heavy wear and tear from our Blue. Make sure it's on a carpeted area or it will slide around, and it can also be pretty loud. BONUS: our 10 month old daughter also loves to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chyenne

customer_reviews.title: A great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: A great product for the price! As anyone who’s a cat owner knows, they can be finicky. I have 5 cats and they all love it. Even one of my older cat’s who never plays with anything enjoys the toy/scratching elements of this... I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Love_to_shop

customer_reviews.title: Mom's cat is obsessed
customer_reviews.text: My mom's cat loves this. He usually just plays with pens he can knock off a table, and we thought we'd never find him something more cat-appropriate to play with. Then we tried this. Not sure why it took us so long to consider one of these devices. He loves it. If he didn't have caps on his nails I'm sure he'd also make use of the center scratch board too. We're just happy that this was inexpensive, came in a nice color for mom's room and keeps Hector the cat thoroughly entertained.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Came Apart Quickly
customer_reviews.text: The scratcher was not wound completely in the middle, leaving enough of a gap for the cats to grab hold of and start unwinding it. Didn't take more than a day for half the scratcher to come out in pieces. Also, the ball came out the first or second day. I was able to get a refund without having to return the product which was nice, but I was hoping it would stay together better than the one which I replaced for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Allison S

customer_reviews.title: Cardboard not super durable; but our cat loves this scratcher.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is obsessed with this scratcher. He has a fancy cat tree with three scratching posts, but we wanted him to have something horizontal as well, which is why we bought his item. He’s really taken a liking to it - the cardboard is already wrecked after three weeks and of all things, he likes lying on it and snoozing when he’s not scratching on it (I mean, why not sleep on the dozens of soft surfaces we provide him with instead? Nope, he wants to sleep on his scratcher). The ball doesn’t get much playtime, but I do occasionally see him playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Solanacea

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these
customer_reviews.text: These hold up really well- I have two cats and they love chasing the ball around, especially after I add a little catnip to the scratcher. My one cat hoards the scratching posts and is a little territorial, so this gives a nice other option for the other cat who doesn't have as easy access to the posts without choosing the furniture. I never used the adhesive, so can't speak to that. It doesn't tend to slide around a bit without it, but it never bothers the cats so it doesn't bother me
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Older cat is NUTS about this toy!  I'm SHOCKED!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 yo female cat. Although selective with her love and picky when it comes to toys, I was hesitant about picking up this Turbo Scratcher thinking she would ignore it. Well, this was definitely not the case. I took it out of the box about 2.5 ours ago and she hasn't left this thing alone. I put the catnip on it that came with the toy, she immediately started attacking the cardboard and then figured out the ball moved playing constantly for about an 45 minutes. Now she's all tuckered out and sleeping on it. Great toy. I will be replacing the parts as they wear away.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dahlgren

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Our playful cat loves this toy. He loves to chase balls (paper, plastic, fur) around the house. However, he gets frustrated with how they get stuck under furniture and such. He eventually gets bored, but with this toy, he loves playing longer. The ball also naturally moves around the track with just a little force. I have had another similar toy where the ball is in between a top and bottom layer, and my cat didn't enjoy that toy nearly as much as this one. Simple and perfect. *On a side note, the other cat we have loves to sit on the circle. He sits on it every day. Haha!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great scratcher.. My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this scratcher hoping my cats will enjoy playing with the ball. Unfortunately, my cats are afraid of the sound that ball makes and won't use it as a toy..yet. But they love the scratcher part. Even before I fully unpack the product, my older cat was there, scratching it. The product comes with a small pack of catnip, but I didn't need it to make my cats to try the scratcher. Hope they will start to play with the ball soon!!
customer_reviews.author: hyen park

customer_reviews.title: Fidget Spinner for Cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two 6 month old kittens and they love this toy/scratcher. I bought two, one for my home-office and one for the family room. I can hear them batting the ball. Of course their attention span isn't very long, but they seem to play with this toy the longest. They use the scratch pad too and then go back to batting the ball around. It really is like a fidget spinner for cats, gives them something to do and becomes addictive for them.
customer_reviews.author: 14GoFast12

customer_reviews.title: My cats both love it, but they fight over "ownership" My large ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats both love it, but they fight over "ownership" My large Maine Coon will frequently lay on top of so the younger cat can't play with it. The only problem is having the cardboard scratch pad in the center, because they use that more then the "ball" feature and get pieces all over the floor. I have gone to using carpet scratch pads instead of the cardboard for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: D. Eoll

customer_reviews.title: Turbo Is Still the Top Toy! Baby Approved!
customer_reviews.text: He loves his Turbo! This is his second one, the first lasted a good 7 years. I only replaced it because I wanted to update the color; it worked fine and was passed on to another lucky cat. I really like the replaceable cardboard center! Ours last forever even though it's the favored claw sharpening spot. If you flip the cardboard upside down you will get a little more mileage from it. No, I did not set it on the stove to apply the catnip. He jumped up on the counter but went straight for it and I was attempting to take it away but he pounced!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Great cat toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes it would keep our lunatic kitten busy and it did its job! He was obsessed the moment I put it on the ground. It took him 6 months or so to rip up the scratching post area but that could also be because he doesn't really use scratching posts often, so I was surprised to catch him using this one a couple of times. He still uses it now when we're asleep and has no one to play with. Very pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Night or day they play away......
customer_reviews.text: My cats love pushing a ball around a little track. They also love catnip. And not too surprisingly they also love to scratch stuff. This covers all three bases nicely. I've several toys of this nature scattered throughout the cats' royal palace and this one gets played with on average twice a day. I have this one in my office - just across from the bed room. And night or day they play away pushing the ball in it's track, stopping it, sending it back, and starting over. Each play session lasts from 3 - 8 minutes depending on which cat it is. We have three and two of them like this more than the third.
customer_reviews.author: Mpls Liz

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well packaged
customer_reviews.text: This came exactly as described. Put together easily. Ball fits great in it. Great price. Unfortunately, through no fault of the product, my cat had no interest. She was a feral cat, so that may have had something to do with it. No worries, I am passing along to another cat friend. If her own cat doesn't like it, she works at a cat shelter where I am sure it will be enjoyed. If your cat likes toys, I would recommend this! I only gave it a 4 because mine had no interest.
customer_reviews.author: DJB0731

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cat Toy!
customer_reviews.text: The first turbo scratcher I received didn't have the ball. I contacted Bergan about it and they sent me a replacement which I received in 3 days, wonderful Company! I have two cats, my tux likes it and will play with it occasionally but my female silver & black tiger loves it! She loves to bat the ball fast one way, then the other way, pounce on it and repeat. They both love the center scratcher too. We can hear her playing "bally" while we're in bed too! This is a great cat toy and I'm really glad I bought it. Thank You, Bergan!
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: If I had known my cat was going to love it so much...
customer_reviews.text: I would’ve bought this ages ago. Only downside, my cat is a jerk and sleeps all day and plays with it all night long! Seriously though, he clearly loves it and for the past 10 years the only thing he has ever loved are empty boxes!
customer_reviews.author: vleecollins23

customer_reviews.title: the ball comes out
customer_reviews.text: My cats had a Turboscratcher that was getting too old and I decided to replace it (I didn't know I could just get the refill for the cardboard!) I found differences with this new one: - it has only one ball (old version has two) - when my cats play, the ball comes out - easy to lose the ball!! (the old version had a narrower channel) - plastic is thinner and lighter than old version
customer_reviews.author: iba4

customer_reviews.title: Our kitten likes it
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten likes this toy. She plays with both the ball and scratches the middle pad regularly. We have only had it about a month though and the middle of the scratch section is coming loose. We can wind it and put it back in, and have considered re-gluing it, but since the middle section is cardboard we worry about re-gluing it being effective, or if it will just rip loose again. I wonder if there would be a more effective scratch pad for the middle?
customer_reviews.author: RLMD

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves scratching it more than the door frames.
customer_reviews.text: It's the cat's favorite toy. I like it because I found something the cat likes scratching more than the door frames. He has attacked it with vengeance, which caused the rubber feet to dislodge. This wouldn't be an issue if the toy was on carpet, but it slides freely on the wood floor. Gluing the feet back in solved the problem nicely. He also enjoys batting the ball at high velocity.
customer_reviews.author: Louisiana Customer

customer_reviews.title: So completely worth the 10.00 price tag
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so my kitten isn't wild about the scratch pad (YMMV on that part), but he is NUTS for the ball in the track. I expected this toy to have some use, but for him to eventually loose interest, like a spoiled child with a new G.I. Joe. Not so. I've had this thing for weeks now, and every couple of days he spends hours going bonkers with this thing. (Part of me can't tell if he loves it or is simply tormented that he can't fully capture the ball.) I can't say it's absolutely his favorite toy of all time, but it's in the top 3 without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: A great cat toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a stray/feral that I managed to catch along w/ her kittens, fall of '19. After finding homes for the kittens, she was very needy and would not engage w/ mouse toys very much. The Bergan Turboscratcher has done a better job of entertaining her. She loves the ball but really has no interest in the scratch pad part which is basically cardboard. For less than $10 I can recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gravy229

customer_reviews.title: Best cat product ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love the turbo cat toy just received. We've been looking for another one since we gave our last one to charity. My cat loves the cat scratch pads and they can be replaced. He never tires of the toy, and my other cat is beginning to take interest. She usually has no desire to play, and just sleeps all day long. Maybe, this will spark her appetite for exercise again.. Also, the price is purrfect since this toy cost more in the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy ever
customer_reviews.text: Hand for over a week now, my cat is 2 and plays with this about 3 to 4 hours total in one day. He is obsessed, the dogs love it as they watch him go crazy over this. He eats everything but luckily has no gotten through the plastic. He never has gotten the ball out so it’s in there pretty good. He doesn’t scratch the center like I thought but now finds it as the perfect place to sit. While it’s annoying to constantly here him go at this, I have never been so happy spending under 10 bucks
customer_reviews.author: ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Five cats, five stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought the toy and an extra light up ball, then bought two more light up balls and three extra scratch pads. The cats absolutely love the thing, and I can see buying at least one more very soon as there has been some pushing and shoving when two or more want to play at the same time. I did learn to remove the white ball at night as the clacking was waking me up. The light up balls don’t make noise.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy and it's the cheapest version of this type of toy I could find. When I first opened it I was skeptical because the plastic looked kind of thin but in practice it's very durable. It's pretty lightweight with just some small rubber stoppers on the bottom to keep it from sliding around, so the cats can move it if they play really enthusiastically, but that doesn't affect their enjoyment of it so I don't mind. The cardboard scratching boards are also replaceable, but the one that comes with it should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best. Cat. Toy. Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this toy! I put it out only once a day so that it stays exciting, she just goes nuts with it. Also, it is heavy enough so that it stays in place and doesn't slide all over the room. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cat continues to play with this sturdy toy
customer_reviews.text: With any cat toy, there's the initial novelty and excitement that wears off. My cat loved it in the beginning and went crazy for it. The good news is that the turboscratcher continues to be a periodic favorite. AND the cat occasionally uses the cardboard to sharpen claws. Very well made, solid, and doesn't tip over. Tip: When attaching the four rubber feet twist each one in like a screw.
customer_reviews.author: AstroGremlin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Got it 2 days early! He loves it. Something new and he spent 4 hours the first day with it......a constant 4 hours. Always plays with it, Tries so hard to get the ball . As for the scratch pad, he uses it daily. So my review is great and his review is MEOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is much better made than I thought it would be. It even has little rubber feet so it doesn’t slide around and scratch the floor. It is very sturdy! Even our little destructor can’t seem to harm it. He was super intrigued the first few days after we got the toy and then his interest faded, but he still enjoys playing with it every once in a while. Reminds me of my children...😂.
customer_reviews.author: L.Sobo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect approved by the Tri-pod Baby Precious
customer_reviews.text: My tri-pod loves this!!!! I due long-term foster and have cats of my own. Most of them like the scratch surface. But it makes me so happy to play with my tri-pod. She pushes the ball, than I do on the opposite side... then she hits it back. Great for mental stimulation too. I am so happy to have this product for her as she is so special.... This product is great! And you can buy replacement scratchers for the inside too.
customer_reviews.author: badorf18

customer_reviews.title: Great for any size cat.
customer_reviews.text: Great size product. I have a large cat, and this gives him enough room to stretch across. He normally not play with toys, so this was a last resort , so to speak. He is actually batting at the ball and watching it go around! The only negative, was the little bag of what I think is supposed to be catnip powder, was stale. There is no smell to it, and my cat didn't react to it at all when I put it on the scratch pad. Normally with the (Kong) catnip leaves, he goes crazy for them,
customer_reviews.author: Cabragg

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Toy, even for Lazy Cat!
customer_reviews.text: We have a slightly chubby, 6 year old cat. She is active at times, but she mostly just lays around and sleeps. She plays with this toy all the time. Sometimes, she just lays on her side with her head propped against it, and spins the ball 'round and 'round for quite a while. She loves the scratching pad too, and will often fall asleep right on top of it after scratching and playing.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: My Sallie loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy. She lays down on it half the time. She even got the ball out once but I put it back. She's had so much fun with this, more than anything I've ever got for her. She loves the scratching thing in the middle too. It is just perfect for her. I've never seen her take to anything like she has to this. She's five years old and I am so glad I got this for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jo J

customer_reviews.title: Works great for dogs too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog after he played with a similar version that my friend's cat uses. He doesn't care at all for the cardboard or the catnip obviously, but he loves the ball. The dish itself is pretty sturdy, but my complaint is the ball actually comes out.... I was hoping that the ball would be permanently stuck in the track. However, I'm alright with this because my dog has learned to take the ball out and I work on his impulse training by spinning the ball around and only letting him grab it (or attempt to grab it) when I allow him.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Works even for older cats
customer_reviews.text: I have several cats who really go to town on my couches. I have these at work and they work for the kittens and younger cats, so I wanted to see if they would work with my cats. The kittens really loved the ball rolling around and the scratcher in the center. My older cats love the scratcher and it's helpful for them but I know I need to get a refill of the center area soon because it's really messed up. I'm super glad my cats use this now. Some of them even sleep on it. 😂 (my 9 year old playing)
customer_reviews.author: feignedlove

customer_reviews.title: Kitten not too interested in product, but quality is okay.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten occasionally plays with it. She only used the scratcher once or twice even after I put catnip on it, but she doesn't use the other scratcher either. She prefers the carpet or throw rug. The rubber feet to keep it from sliding wouldn't stay on, but since it's on carpet it's okay without them. I'm not dissatisfied with it, it just doesn't hold her attention.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: Ball pops out
customer_reviews.text: It was great, until my cat figured out how to pop the dang ball out. I don't know if my cat is stronger than average because of his size (big and solid - 14#), I know good and well it isn't because he's got smarts (he don't), or if it's that they need to curve the top lip over a smidge more so it can't be popped out. Whatever the reason, two of the three would be moot, if they'd fix it in the manufacturing process. Sad for us, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Buttercup

customer_reviews.title: Not made very well
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed is that this rendition of the cat toy is not as stiff as the origional. It seems that the plastic is softer and it is also thinner. I woke up today which is 1.2.2019 and now the ball is missing. I will be returning the cat toy asap bc the first one still has its ball and it is over 6 years old no problems.
customer_reviews.author: grandbeauch

customer_reviews.title: So far so good....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a new kitten we adopted, I was under the assumption by the picture we would be getting 2 but its my fault for not reading. It is a pretty large diameter so perfect for a kitten to adult cat. The only issue I had was the cardboard in the middle was already banged up and loose in the center. Other than that our cat loves it. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Way

product_meta.title: Bergan Turboscratcher Cat Toy (Assorted)
product_meta.description:
The Turbo Scratcher Cat Toy includes a spinning ball, non-skid feet and scratch pad. Catnip included. The scratch pad keeps cats entertained so they don't chew or tear furniture. Replacement pads also available.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Bergan's famous Turbo Scratcher Cat Toy (Colors Vary) is designed to provide hours of fun for your furry companion. When cats have an appropriate outlet for their need to scratch, there is a smaller chance they will damage your upholstery and woodwork. The Turbo Scratcher a channel for a small ball your cat can nudge with its nose or shove with its paw. In the center of the Turbo Scratcher, the textured scratch pad is both durable and replaceable. When you need to replace the pad, order the Bergan Turbo Scratcher Replacement Pad in the handy 2-pack (sold separately). Bergan products are designed to help you enjoy life with your pet.
feature_bullets: Cat Toy and Scratcher Pad offers hours of fun and exercise for your cat while reducing potential furniture damage due to scratching.
Catnip and ball included. Scratch pad is replaceable. 16i 1/2 Diameter x 1.88i 1/2
